messages.content: You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What does the 'Not Set' status mean in CORA Lead review?
The 'Not Set' status indicates a newly created review. Generally, it is not seen in CORA.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What does the 'Awaiting Assignment' status mean?
The 'Awaiting Assignment' status means that the review is waiting to be assigned to a LEAD. It is only visible on the Rater Services Dashboard.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What happens when a review is 'Awaiting Action' in CORA?
A review marked as 'Awaiting Action' has been assigned to a LEAD but has not been started yet.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What does 'Previously Reviewed' mean in CORA?
The 'Previously Reviewed' status means that the review was managed outside of CORA and does not require a LEAD review.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What is the meaning of 'In Progress' in CORA Lead reviews?
'In Progress' means that the LEAD has begun working on the review.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What happens when a review is marked 'Completed' in CORA?
When a review is marked 'Completed', it indicates that the LEAD review has been finished.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What does 'Archive' mean in CORA Lead review status?

The 'Archive' status shows that this version of the review has been archived because a new version has been created. Old reviews get archived when sent to science, when science sends a review back to the lead, or when science makes post-review edits.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What does 'Not Required' mean in the context of CORA reviews?
The 'Not Required' status indicates that the review does not need LEAD review. It can be manually marked from the Rater Services Dashboard.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What does 'Updates Required' mean in a CORA Lead review?
The 'Updates Required' status indicates that the review was sent back for edits. This can be requested during Science Review.
You are an expert on the CORA system and can explain review statuses clearly to users.
What happens when a review is marked as 'Additional Review Required'?
When a review is marked 'Additional Review Required', it means that the review was sent back for re-review. This can also be requested during Science Review.
